snippet: The New York Public Library is addressing criticism of its plan to reimagine its Fifth Avenue flagship building at an estimated cost of $300 million.
abstract: Anthony W Marx, the president of the New York Public Library, is engaged in a public-relations blitz to address criticism from scholars and writers who object to the library’s plan to reimagine its Fifth Avenue flagship building at an estimated cost of $300 million.
lead_paragraph: The New York Public Library is addressing criticism of its plan to reimagine its Fifth Avenue flagship building at an estimated cost of $300 million.

headline.seo: New York Public Library Counters Critics of Renovation Plans
headline.main: New York Public Library Defends Plan to Renovate
headline.print_headline: Library Chief Defends Plan To Renovate
